Text.Value: There's no place for your balking here, hoon. Pick a side or get out.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quietly aggressive; thinks the player is being cowardly

Text.Value: Glad I could defuse the situation.
Laridda? It would've been simpler if you'd told her I was dead. Begged me to take her back when she saw me.

EditorData.NodeContext: As if trying to recall something unimportant
EditorData.logicalname: IF SAID PHIL BROKE UP WITH

Text.Value: I overheard you're gonna be helping us fight the good fight. Knew I would've regretted blowing you up.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little surprised but mainly genuinely glad

Text.Value: Might've overheard you talking to Wulbren - sounds like you got cold feet.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little sheepish but mainly interrogative

Text.Value: Funny. You're gonna need that sense of humour here.

EditorData.NodeContext: She is not (that) amused by the pun

Text.Value: You didn't make it easy.
Life isn't easy, hoon - remember that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tough; a little angry that the player called her difficult considering the circumstances

Text.Value: You don't know what the Gondians are capable of! Do you realise how many people the Steel Watchers have killed already?
You had a lover back in Grymforge, didn't you? How is she?
Laridda? She was a bit surprised to find out I wasn't dead, to put it mildly. Then angry.

EditorData.NodeContext: As if trying to recall something unimportant

Text.Value: Glad we both made it out of Grymforge alive - and that I didn't have to use that runepowder to make a point.
I'm just thinking through my options - rushed plans make for dead mages.
I'm still thinking about it.
Chuck your questions at Wulbren - that's his job. I can make time for chatter after you know what's what.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive/keen to get Wulbren to handle the annoying stuff

Text.Value: Drugning coward. I should've rolled you in runepowder and thrown you in the fire when I had the chance.
Huh - you look different when you're not trying to talk someone down from igniting a barrel of runepowder.
Better get on with it, then - Wulbren wouldn't've put his trust in you for nothing.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keen to get the player to act ASAP

Text.Value: Make yourself useful or make yourself scarce.
Dead. But Laridda should've shown some backbone instead of sitting there waiting to be rescued.
That's why we never would've worked - and why she wasn't cut out for the Ironhand clan.
Wulbren told me about the plan for that runepowder.
Back again? You stick around like smokepowder stink.
Listen - I'd gladly incinerate this entire basement and everyone in it if it'd mean taking out the Gondians once and for all.
I made it clear there was nothing between us and after a while she finally got the message.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat dismissive; she doesn't really care that much

Text.Value: I can't do it, I'm sorry.
Now you've spoken to the big man, good to see you. Never thought I'd meet you again - let alone fight on the same side.
Do you realise how many people could get hurt by this?
Now we can both focus on what's actually important - taking out the Gondians.
Don't think too much - we can't afford to waste time or runepowder.

Synopsis: Ironhand gnome Philomeen hiding in a smithy cellar (came from Act1). At first, Philomeen appears in Oppress Scene
